level.heading: False statements as to liens; violations of law chapter.
level.text: Any person intentionally making a false statement with respect to liens in an application for a certificate, or wilfully violating any of the provisions of this chapter, shall upon conviction be punished by a fine of not more than $5,000 or be imprisoned for not more than 1 year, or both. Prosecutions for violations of this chapter shall be by the Corporation Counsel of the District of Columbia or any of his assistants, in the name of the District of Columbia.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 16-279, increased the fine for violation of the section from not more than $500 to not more than $5,000.
